dialogues.text: He hangs up, and looks from the gun up to Sal's blank har face.  To his own amazement, he grins: a hopeful grin tha says: "Like me - don't hurt me."  And he's embarrassed by it.  As we watch, his smile turns sour.

Sonny then frisk Howard and has a sudden afterthought as he locks the door again.  He quickly unlocks it and shouts out at Jackie.

dialogues.text: (gasping for breath) Huh?

dialogues.text: (stands, receiver  still to ear, then  covering it with his  hand) Howard, give him the keys...

dialogues.text: Sonny grabs the gun from the desk top and moves over to  Mulvaney.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR AT FRONT OF BANK
dialogues.text: The man walks straight toward the glass door, already lif his hand to shadow his eyes, so when he reaches the door, he'll be able to see inside.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON SAL AND MULVANEY
dialogues.text: Sal brings the gun up so he can shoot the man, at the sam time, crabbing himself aside so he is concealed behind  Mulvaney and the desk.  Mulvaney sees the approaching man and cups his hand over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the insurance guy across the  street.  He probably saw the goddamn  smoke! (motions toward smoking  register) Please!  Put out the fire!

dialogues.speaker: ON MAN
dialogues.text: The last few feet from the door.

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: who rushes through the teller's cages gate toward the  register, grabs the smoking register, throws it onto the  floor near Edna's desk, and starts to stamp it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get some water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before anyone can move, Sonny grabs the gun on them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody move! Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women now begin to scream as real hysteria sets in. Deborah screams, collapses.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: The man actually kicks the glass with his foot, then lean against the glass, shades his eyes, trying to see in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... I can't talk now... I'll  call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND of hanging up.  The man is looking all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard, wave him off.  Tell him we're  closed.  Whatever...

dialogues.speaker: ON HOWARD
dialogues.text: who is useless.

dialogues.speaker: ON MULVANEY
dialogues.text: who starts to move toward the front door, looking over at Sonny trying to put out the fire. CAMERA FOLLOWS MULVANEY TO THE FRONT DOOR; Sonny moves wi him, covering him all the time.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: as Sonny stands behind closed venetian blinds to listen t the conversation and to cover Mulvaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun's right on your back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the keys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny hands him the keys.

dialogues.speaker: SAL
dialogues.text: He raises the gun and sights it now, and in this moment, should sense a kind of luxurious relaxation into anticipa on Sal's part.  He is smiling a little, and for the first time, looks happy, and that's what makes him seem dangero He's looking forward to an excuse to kill.  It's here now survival.  There is something almost sexual about the way settles his body down behind the weapon, getting ready fo the squeeze on the trigger, the report, the violent shove recoil against his muscles and sinews. In the background, we see Sylvia bringing Howard a cup of water.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: emphasizing the small of Mulvaney's back.  The man is som he knows from across the street.  He looks worried and  mystified...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unlocking door) What is it, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's all right?  You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just a cigarette got in a  wastebasket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  Sam stares around... thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little smoke: like a Polish four- alarm fire, is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Well, you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks for keeping an eye out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not satisfied, but he can't see anything and he can' think of anything more to say, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. [Regards to the family,  Sam.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney locks the door and walks inside the bank, giving the keys back to Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, will you please go  now?  We gave you every nickel we  got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goin' outside with me.  If  there's no cops around, we just split.   Otherwise, you go with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney and Sonny starts to walk back toward Sal.  As th do, the PHONE BEGINS TO RING AGAIN (#3).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mulvaney) Answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney shrugs helplessly.  Picks up the phone, standing desk opposite his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - it's all right... let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mulvaney here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHOT - SONNY & SAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal, get 'em in the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get 'em in the vault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sal starts to herd them into the vault (Sylvia helping Howard, still with the cup of water), Mulvaney is still o the phone.  Sonny moves down to get the money bag atop th teller's cages and we hear Mulvaney on phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tired) What property is that, Mrs. Anterio? The Third Avenue property - you  already got a second mortgage on.   We discussed it before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are afraid; Miriam unlocks the gate as Sonny us Mulvaney's keys to the matching lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from inside vault  area) You won't close the vault?  How can  we breathe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's okay... just close the  gate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylvia, helping Howard, is the last to go through the gat As Sonny is about to lock the gate, she turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'll never make it.  I'll  have to go to the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter... they never  housebroke you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a joke.  I got this terrible  fear of being locked in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah shit.  Okay... go ahead.  Anybody  else have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see... now they all gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sylvia starts to move out, Sonny starts to cross ahead her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute - I want to check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney finishes his phone conversation.  He moves towar the group at the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny sprints for the door to the Ladies' Room.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE LADIES' ROOM
dialogues.text: It is a little lounge; sitting on a couch under the windo making up her face (or painting her toenails) and listeni to her tiny transistor radio, oblivious to all that's  happened, is MARIA, heavily-painted and voluptuous Latin  girl.  Sylvia, following him in, is shocked.  She's forgo about Maria.  Now she runs over to her, puts her arms aro her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - Maria!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?  God damn it! What the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria is about to protest, but Sylvia grabs her and start to hustle her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to pull?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot she's in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, nobody's going to the  bathroom - come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves with them back to the vault area, herds them int it.  At this point, PHONE RINGS AGAIN (#4).  Sonny moves get the empty wastebasket, shoving it into the vault for girls to use in case of emergency.  Mulvaney moves to his desk and phone. Mulvaney has by this time answered the phone, and is now  holding it out to Sonny.  HOLD THE BEAT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sonny) It's for you.

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY AND SAL
dialogues.text: They both stare at Mulvaney.  Sonny slowly moves toward  Mulvaney.  For the first time since he entered the bank,  he's quiet and slow.  He takes the instrument and slowly  puts it to his ear.  The group from the vault now slowly  starts to move out to listen to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin' in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Detective Sergeant Moretti,  asshole, we got you completely by  the balls.  You don't believe me,  I'm lookin' you right in the eye. Right now, I can see you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny turns and looks out through the door.  Sure enough, the window of the barbershop across the street, the dim f of a man on a telephone can be SEEN looking out toward us He wears a hat in spite of the weather and a cigar is cla in his mouth.  He is an old-time, hard-nosed, uneducated, street-wise, sarcastic New York cop, outspoken, rude and  sentimental.  Right now he's a distant silhouette and a v on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: holding the phone.  Listening to the voice of his death  speaking in New York accents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?  Let's be reasonable and not  stupid and not get anybody hurt. You come to the front door with hands  folded on your head, unnastand?   Nobody's gonna shoot or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny slowly, almost sadly, puts the telephone receiver b down, cutting off the little voice at the other end.  He  looks up at Mulvaney, then to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sal) It's the cops.  Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing away from  Sonny) I swear to God... on my salary, I'm  not gonna be any hero...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the fire, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, just go, get out when  you could, but no, you just got to  hang around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny is pacing back and forth, trying to figure out what do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!  I gotta have time to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  Did you just barge in  here... He doesn't have plan.  It's  all a whim. (sarcastic) 'Rob a bank!  What not?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Just give me time to think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all in the barrel together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone continues to ring.  Sonny finally grabs it (desk  opposite Mulvaney).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) All right, bastards!  You keep away  from the bank or we start throwing  bodies out the front door one at a  time.  You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A startled apologetic man's voice speaks: Now ANOTHER PHO BEGINS TO RING (#6).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just called to ask Jenny what time  she's gonna get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny abruptly holds the phone out from his body at arm's length, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a Jenny here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody moves.  They all stare at him.  Finally he singles her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny starts to move toward Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him the truth!  Tell him whatever  you tell him!

dialogues.speaker: OTHER PHONE CONTINUES TO RING
dialogues.text: As he puts down the phone for her to pick up, Sonny reach for the other phone that is RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a fuckin' comedy! (into phone) WNEW plays all the hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, first off, is anybody hurt  in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But you keep away from the bank  or we start throwing bodies out the  front door one at a time... You got  it?  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the phone.  Sal looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The bodies out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to think that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But do you mean it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this moment, Jenny, phone in hand, is turned to him,  respectfully like a child in an authoritarian household,  addressing her father:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to know what time you think  you'll be through.

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: stares at her.  For the first time, he realizes how frigh she is, how serious, grotesque, and funny it all is.  He  takes the time to be tender with her, as though she were not-too-bright child in the presence of a tragedy she'll  never understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Sonny turns to speak to Mulvaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the back door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's locked on the inside. (beat) It's through that passageway and to  the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny disappears toward the back door.  Jenny continues h phone conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he doesn't know.  Why don't  you cook whatever's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a whole roast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, send out for Kentucky fried  chicken.  The baby, just open a bottle  of prunes, and one of the beef.  The  bottles are in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jenny) Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how to fix the bottle.  They  got guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with the baby on her  mind) What guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robbers in the bank.  They got  guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  A lot of guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, stay away from them.  Don't  get close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, I will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Sonny returns from the rear door area, sees that she' still on the phone and signals to her to hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jenny - let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hon?  I got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny hesitates.  Everyone is looking at her.  They look  away, as though to give her privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Well, I got to go now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of silence.  Realizes she can't talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kiss the baby for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (past embarrassment) I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and then crosses to the group by the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on Sonny as he moves to Sal, to reassure Sal out of some  guiltiness about trapping him in this situation.  His ton apologetic... almost tender...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal, I'm sorry about this.  But we  can get outta this thing.  There's a  way outta this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?  About throwin' a  body outta here if we have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I stalled him for a while. When it comes the time, then we'll  work it out.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But do you mean it?... But you just  told him that if worse comes to  worse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to think that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want to know what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you right now - that I'm  ready to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Sonny moves over to the group at the vault gate and s to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I want to say is...  everything's  gonna be all right...  if we all  cooperate and we don't, you know...  carry on... I don't know you and you  don't know me...  and what I'm tryin'  to tell you is that if you stay cooled  out, we can work this thing out and  nobody's going to get hurt... believe  me, I don't want to hurt anybody... Everybody is going to have a chance  to do what they have to do...  she's  gotta go to the bathroom - so you go -  and you can go after... Everybody's  gonna get a chance... Everybody's  gonna get a chance to use the phone...  Let's just take it a step at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny now turns toward Mulvaney.  Howard lies down, head jacket, in the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mulvaney) Now, you -- what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me are checking the other  ways in and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal takes a position where he can cover the door and also the girls and Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny and Mulvaney move toward the rear of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to the back door. (referring to Howard) How'd that guy get to be a guard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they go to guard school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what... learn how to shoot? They don't get a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make $105 a week to start. They fold the flag, check the place  out in the morning.  I don't know  what they learn, Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At some point in their move toward the rear door, Sylvia  exits the Ladies' room and moves back toward the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are... the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at it.  It is big, black, steel and seems solid Sonny tests it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could shoot the lock... I want  to block it, so if they try comin'  here, we're gonna hear it.  Here,  you pull on that side. (puts gun aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has found a big office machine, a Xerox or whatever, w he now starts to push toward the door.  On the opposite s Mulvaney starts to pull it toward the door.  It's very he and they have to strain to budge it at all.  Meanwhile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got two kids... and I'd like to  see them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I know!  You're being very  cooperative.  I got no complaint  against you whatever; you got bank  insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney has removed his suit jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I do.  You seem to know a  lot about bank procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny laughs and pushes the machine.  Mulvaney pulls from the opposite side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask me questions.  I got  connections.  You find out who I am,  you're cold meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care who you are... (shove) I just want to get you outta here,  safe, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I take you with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping to rest for  a beat, thinking) If you take anybody, please take me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll shoot you; the fucking cops'll  shoot you... they don't give a damn.   In spite of that bank insurance.   You see what they did in Attica,  they shot everybody, the hostages,  prisoners, cops, guards, forty-two  people they killed, the innocent  with the guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have the machine almost to the door now, with Mulvan almost pinned between the machine and the door.  He eases himself out.  Looks at the gun, then at Sonny, then they  shove the machine against the door.  Sonny then gives Mul his jacket to put on again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I'm not gonna take you. I'm gonna take one of the girls, a  married one with a couple of kids.   The cops don't like it in the papers  when they kill a mother, especially  if she's got young kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished with the task, Sonny takes his gun and with Mulv they start to cross back toward Sal and the rest of the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just a nice guy, Mr. Mulvaney. Only don't fuck around with me, you  know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fool around with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney crosses back to his desk and sits down.  At this point, all the phones are off the hooks.

dialogues.speaker: EXT., (AERIAL)
dialogues.text: As it banks steeply we can see past Pilot to bank, and co around car.  We see a small crowd being held back by a fe police still setting up barricades.  It is the first  indication of the crowd event it became.  It also sets th geography for us, but very quickly another copter swims i view and the two circle each other.  The other copter --  only feet away -- is a TV news helicopter, with a big cam sticking out the open door on our side. It is turned down by the Cameraman to focus on the bank. COP in the police helicopter yells through his bullhorn a the TV Cameraman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a restricted area.  You are  flying in a restricted area...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV Cameraman swivels his camera up to focus on the Co and as the lens hits us dead center...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though an open window a fire escape can be seen and beyon it an angle of street and the bank.  Near the window in a corner is a TV set, and on the TV set we are seeing the s of the police helicopter and the Cop yelling on the bullh as seen from the TV copter.  A couple of Elderly Men are  sitting watching the TV set, ignoring the bank, which the can see in the flesh, as it were.  Outside we are HEARING the copters, and on the TV set likewise, and the voice of the Announcer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...police as yet have made no contact  with the bank robbers who are locked  in the bank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a HAMMERING at the door, and the men at the TV s barely have time to look around before several burly Cops wearing flak vests and helmets and carrying sniper rifles with telescopic slights move through the room, ignoring t men.  They move out onto the fire escape, a couple going higher, settling themselves down to aim in their rifles o the front of the bank.  A lot of AD LIB dialogue, but wha we note is the Cops, as a man, take a look at themselves the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FRAME is full of cop faces... tough, mesomorphic face with a layer of fat under the skin, increasing as age.  T have the look of cops: alert, curious, weighing.  They ar city cops; they don't have that old-fashioned condemnator expression, there is an element of playfulness in their n the fact is they love their work, which is criminals.  Th is a peculiar delight in ferreting out the criminal impul in everybody, and a matching fury in punishing it -- whic is the action of repressing their own strongly developed  criminal unconscious.  These are tense, funny, violent, a rigidly controlled men. MORETTI is an old-line cop, a lot more relaxed than the  younger men and the cold professionals of the FBI, who as group resemble astronauts, and like them hide (but do not deny) the psychic chaos underneath. Right now they are looking at the sky.  We HEAR a heavy  helicopter track. We feature SHELDON, the silver-haired FBI Agent-in-Charge who looks like an accountant, and Moretti, with hat and c and a face out of Warner Brothers movies of the Forties. spite of Sheldon's age, Moretti plays though he's a smart kid who still needs a little help. Sheldon is getting out of a gray car, wears a gray suit. Three men with him are carbon copies of him at younger ag The three hang around him.  They approach Moretti who loo at them without moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to no one) Here comes the FBI. (to Sheldon) You men lookin' for protection?  We  got all the police right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you just wait and try to  take 'em out there in the street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti looks at him, cheerfully sarcastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made an error in judgment.  I  thought the sons of bitches would be  overwhelmed with remorse at the sight  of a police officer.  And you know  somethin'?  Nobody has said hostage  yet.  Unnastan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are moving past Cops on the corner heading toward a  small barbershop across the street from the bank.  We now sense the growing crowd, standing quietly, just staring n yet knowing what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From down the street come a group of odd-looking men in s carrying all kinds of electric junk: The NEW REPORTERS.   They run heavily, sweating martinis and cigarette smoke.. they run up to Moretti and Sheldon, who walk along, tryin not to catch an eye. MOVING SHOT - MORETTI AND SHELDON AMONG NEWSMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many in the bank? Have they got hostages?  Any shots  exchanged? (Etc., AD LIB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we don't know that yet.  This  young fella without the hat is FBI.   I'm Detective Sergeant Eugene Moretti  ... M-O-R-E-double-T-I.  Eugene.  I  don't give a shit, but my wife cries  if you spell it wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have arrived at the barber shop where Moretti fights his way inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COP is talking on the wall phone as MORETTI, BAKER, etc are trying to get inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no, just get hold of Al, tell him  to get the catering truck over to  26th and Avenue B, there's a bank  robbery in progress and big crowd.   Big!  Tell him to bring ice cream --  I got to hang up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and immediately begins thumbing through a POC PHONE BOOK.  Throughout this Cop is engaged in personal  business on the fringe of this affair, and though he's on duty he hardly knows what's happening on the robbery.  He trying to get his brother-in-law with the ice cream truck down here, etc. Moretti has got the crowd cleared back, so that now we SE why this has been chosen as a tactical command post.  Fro here, while talking on the phone, Moretti can see the ban and through the uncurtained door he can even see some dis inside. Moretti picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone cop) You get the phone company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's being set up... this phone'll  be a direct line into the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti is already dialing.  The phone is answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Re Moretti's 3rd conversation on phone with Sonny.) The group inside the bank have now been waiting approxima twelve minutes since anything last happened.  Sonny is se at Mulvaney's desk, all the phones off the hooks. The rest of the group is huddled around the vault area wh Sal is keeping his eye on them. Suddenly, Sonny jumps up and puts all the receivers back the hooks, crossing back to sit at Mulvaney's desk again. PHONE STARTS TO RING and Sonny picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're in there and we're out  here.  What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you -- keep away.  I don't  know what we do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright, but I wanna talk to you. First off, we wanna know if the people  in the bank are okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alone, or you got confederates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many you got in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal?  What's that for?  Salvatore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal.  He's the killer.  We're Vietnam  veterans so killing don't mean  anything to us, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop passing by presses a portable two-way radio into  Moretti's hand: He accepts it and holds as though he expe it.  The Cop passes the same type of set to certain other officers.  These sets are tuned in to each other, and  throughout the movie, there is a constant background talk these sets.  This is police procedure; the orders are for everyone to talk about everything.  If anyone has a quest has heard a rumor or a sound, whatever, it is immediately responded to, so that there can be the fewest possible  surprises.  Sample dialogue might go: "Did I hear a shot? "Over here, by the bank, there was a report like a gunsho inside."  "Roger, we heard that from the barbershop... it was inside the bank."  "Barbershop, you can see inside?" "Roger, we heard from the barbershop... it was inside the bank."  "Barbershop, you can see inside?"  "Roger, this i the barbershop, we see inside, the perpetrator is moving  toward the rear of the bank."  "Who's that guy walking th the barricade?"  "The blue suit?"  "Yeah."  "Off-duty  Inspector come down to see can you use him."  Etc.  They  really do use the word Perpetrator, Felon, etc.  The Cop  handing out radios makes Moretti sign for it -- which Mor does during the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right -- got ya.  Okay, so there's  you -- what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to know that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a name, any name, just so I  got somethin' to call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Sonny-boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny-boy, one word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One word.  You won't find it in the  phone book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Sonny... can I call you Sonny  for short?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Sonny, I want to see if the  people in the bank are okay, then  what I want to do is work out a way  to get them out of there.  I want to  come over there, without a gun...  and you can frisk me.  So you can  see you can trust me.  So we can  talk and find a way outta this mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I frisk you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You frisk me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right -- I'm with you, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like just some sign I can trust  you too, Sonny.  I don't want to  trust my body out where you could  just shoot me.  Some sight... right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... like... I'm not gonna shoot  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about letting the people out of  the bank.  Why put them in this  position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're what's keeping me alive. You think you're dealing with an  idiot?  Talk to me then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, give us the women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no... Women is all we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all one way!  I'm bein'  reasonable with you; give me  somethin'... Give me one of them,  anyway... Just one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- you want me to send one out  there... Okay.  I'll see what I can  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny hangs up and moves over to Sal.  The rest of the gr has been trying to make out what's being said at the othe end of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sal) He wants one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead or alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Sonny looks at the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... who's gonna go first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney now stands up at his desk, looks over at the gro near the vault.  They look back at him, waiting for some  instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up to you ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now unified.  Sonny whispers something to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To show that we're negotiating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... send them the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylvia takes Howard by the arms and starts to lead him to the front door.  Sal watches as they move toward front do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover her, Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny moves with them toward the front door, his gun aime at them during the walk. Finally they arrive, and Howard moves toward the door by  himself.  But the door is obviously locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny gives her the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the rear) Only one, Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny covers Sylvia as she moves to unlock the front door for Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go along, Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Howard is pushed out the door by Sylvia, a cop from a  nearby car rushes up to him and shoves him to a curbside where he bends Howard over the car, putting his hands beh him for handcuffs and starts to frisk him.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUTS
dialogues.text: About 100 weapons ranging from machine guns to hand guns sniper rifles are whipped up and pointed straight at his  chest and head.  The effect is as though he is about to b blown entirely away.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARBER SHOP
dialogues.text: Moretti rushes out, screaming to the cop with Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say fire?  What fire?  Do we  fire or what?  Who fired? (Etc.)

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS COPS
dialogues.text: Confusion reigns.  They don't know if the perpetrator or  not, since they haven't yet seen Sal or Sonny.  Guns  are up, aimed, being pushed down... Cops run for better vanta points.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: as Moretti reaches him.  He pulls the cop away from him a starts to give him hell for the rough treatment being giv the guard.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR OF BANK
dialogues.text: With Sylvia in doorway, staring wildly at the street scen Sonny is beside her covering her with his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!  That's Howard!  We voted to  send him out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the cops slowly realize their mistake.  They stand bac from Howard, who is virtually catatonic with fear and sho now.  They get him up, a reluctant to believe they could  have made such a mistake...

dialogues.speaker: TV CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: Near barber shop, across the street, jockeying, trying to focus in on him, elbowing each other, they yell out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Come out, get in the light.   Hey, out where we can get a shot,  huh?  Who's the black guy? (etc. AD LIBS)

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER, (TO AND FROM)
dialogues.text: swings in over street to try for a shot.  Howard is being taken in the direction of the barber shop.

dialogues.speaker: MORETTI
dialogues.text: to Cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him outta here!

dialogues.speaker: DOOR OF BANK
dialogues.text: Sonny back in the shadows with Sylvia, looking at Moretti appalled.

dialogues.speaker: ON MORETTI
dialogues.text: Behind him a mob scene.  Howard is being led away, weepin Photographers, cops, a phalanx of cops have their weapons levelled on Sonny like a firing squad.  It is right on th edge of violence... of blowing up.  Sonny and Sylvia are the shelter of the doorway, Moretti stands on the sidewal looking toward Sonny inside the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny - come out here a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point, he removes his jacket and drops it to the  ground, showing Sonny that he is unarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got these cops outta here. They're comin' in too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  I want you to see something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to give up, huh?  Look,  Sal's in back with the girls.   Anything happens to me - one move -  and Sal gives it to them.  Boom boom.   How do I know you won't jump me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't forget about Sal and the  boom boom room.  I want you to see  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny turns back to tell Sal he's going outside.  Moretti stands well out in the street, to reassure Sonny nobody i going to try to jump him.  Sonny stares around; he nudges Sylvia out ahead of him.  As they edge into sight of the  Media across the street:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in the light.  Hey, Lady!  You're  on TV, Lady!  Smile, any...  god  damn thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: straining against police lines: this is where we begin to sense the size of the event.  People are eating popsicles and ice cream.  They are diverted and excited.  Sonny and Sylvia begin to emerge: CATCALLS and HOOTS of greeting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he looks around, and the impact of his situation reall hits him: he's not only totally surrounded, he's an event Some of the crowd CHEER him.  An army of Cops, and guns a levelled on Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let Sal come out, take a look.  What  hope you got?  Quit while you're  ahead.  All you got is attempted  robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...armed robbery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, armed, then.  Nobody's been  hurt.  Release the hostages, nobody  is gonna worry over kidnapping  charges, the worst you're gonna get  is five years -- you can be out in a  year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny stares at him, his face utterly blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti stops, stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) When I'm bein' fucked, I like to be  kissed a lot. (bursting out) Who the fuck are you tryin' to con  me into some deal?  You're a city  cop, where's the FBI?  This is a  federal offense, I got kidnapping,  armed robbery, they're gonna bury  me!  You know it, you can't talk for  them, you're some flunky pig tryin'  to bullshit me.  Now God damn it,  get somebody in charge here to talk  to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, you're not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down... look at this, look at  him...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gestures at the cops, the wall of rifles and machine guns levelled on him.  It is incredible and terrifying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) They wanna kill me so bad they can  taste it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a defiant step into the street.  The crowd SCREA as they get their first view, which is of Sonny telling t Cops off.  They don't need to hear the words, they can se it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Attica!  Attica!  Go ahead!  Blow  off the front of the whole God damn  bank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds his hands wide offering himself as a target to t hulking officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the TV) If it wasn't for you guys they'd  kill everybody and say it was me and  Sal. (to Moretti) You tell 'em to put the guns down. I can't stand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means it.  Moretti gestures to the officers to back aw lower the guns.  The crowd YELLS: Sonny has beat the Cops He is momentarily their hero. It's a breaking point.  Moretti makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cop language command  to put gun away) All right - put the guns down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to YELL it twice before the Cop slowly, angrily, s the gun into his holster. SOUND: The crowd screams.

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: hearing the Crowd APPLAUSE.  He turns and grins and waves them.  They SCREAM more.  He turns and waves to the media They've been YELLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, over here!  Give us a wave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is at this point that newsman leans out a window of th second floor of the bank, quickly lowering a mike boom. Sylvia sees this above her head.

dialogues.speaker: ON MORETTI
dialogues.text: unhappy, looking around at Sheldon, who shrugs.  He did w he had to do.

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: Suddenly realizing what control he has, enjoying it.  He  turns mockingly his left and his right profile to cameras

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FAT WOMAN runs heavily, stumbling, a delighted grin on face, up the stairs PAST CAMERA, yelling to someone unsee upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi!  Oh, Jesus.  Vi!  Turn on the  TV, turn the TV on, you can see it's  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small, jammed with little things of sentimental value and cheap furniture, clean, but well-worn.  VI, a small woman her fifties, with a perpetual smile, and the sweating Fat Woman trot in, just as Vi's HUSBAND, a dour man in his  fifties, is exiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I swear to God it looked just  like him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates in the doorway as the two women rush to the which is already on, the station showing live coverage of the bank robbery.  On SCREEN, Sonny can be seen ordering cops around.  Moretti looks furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the recognizes  Sonny) Oh, My God in Heaven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the robber, whose identity is not  known, came out of the bank, with a  hostage, Mrs. Sylvia Ball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud) Did I tell you?  He looks good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doin' this for?  He didn't  tell me he needed money.  He would  of told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mrs. Ball, is everyone all right  in the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why rob a bank when you got a sucker  for a mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, the one girl was cryin',  but we're havin' a ball, so far, if  just nobody shoots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't he tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the man inside the bank? What is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope he gives the wrong name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for TV to turn it off.  Vi stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal?  He never talks, only goes: 'Sonny, you want me to shoot that  one, this one.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all there is -- that little  bastard down there in the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ball, do you think they might  shoot, if they get desperate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got money for the subway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait, he's goin' back in. (she turns OUT OF  PICTURE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subway!  It's a special occasion -- take a cab, for God's sake!

dialogues.speaker: NEW IMAGE
dialogues.text: Sonny returning toward bank.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY AND MORETTI
dialogues.text: as they shake hands.  As Sonny starts into the bank first he holds the door open, waiting for Sylvia.  In the meant the 2nd-floor media man yells down to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up toward  them) I gotta go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, lady... you're out now.  Stay  out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, waiting patiently, holds door open for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're my girls.  They need me in  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she walks through the door past Sonny and into the ba Moretti yells up at the media to get the hell away and at the same time, turns to a nearby cop and gives orders for the air conditioning to be turned off inside the bank. As the crowd realizes what has happened, they APPLAUD and SCREAM.  At the door:

dialogues.speaker: BANK DOOR
dialogues.text: as Sonny turns to grin and wave back at crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny and Sylvia walk into bank and head for the group the rear.  Mulvaney is seated at his desk, but the rest o the girls are standing around the vault area. Sylvia heads for the girls as Sonny walks toward Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, girls -- I was on television...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to passing Sonny) What about Howard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny makes reassuring gesture to let him know Howard is  safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mulvaney) Turn on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney turns on the TV set.  In the meantime, Sylvia ha reached the other girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sylvia begins to recount the events out on the street mainly about herself as a television celebrity.

dialogues.speaker: TV SET
dialogues.text: as we see the image of a TV NEWSMAN across the street.  T as his director CUTS, we will see on the TV set an ANGLE ON THE BANK AS SEEN FROM ACROSS THE STREET. The TV Cameraman ZOOMS and the TV image ZEROES IN through the door to show a partially-screened but quite clear ima of Sonny, talking to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sal) The whole media is out there... it  looks a lot better for us than it  did before...

dialogues.speaker: ON SAL
dialogues.text: absorbing this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see the robbers inside the  bank, and we're trying now to  establish contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the telephone to the bank  manager, Patrick J. Mulvaney... Mister  Mulvaney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I can hear you.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: serious, nodding to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you put the robber on the phone? Will he talk to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna talk to him... Sonny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny turns, trying to understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV... they want to talk to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out the phone.  Sonny walks over to him and take the receiver.  On the TV screen, we can see him doing thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah?  Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you're on the air.  I wonder if  you'd answer a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sal) Hey, Sal... (to phone) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbing a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... It's where they got  the money.  I mean, if you want to  steal, you go to where they got the  money, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny now edges over and sits on top of Edna's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I mean, why do you need to steal?   Couldn't you get a job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a job doing what?  You gotta be  a member of a union, no union card -  no job.  To join the union, you gotta  get the job, but you don't get the  job without the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about, ah, non-union occupations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?  Bank teller?  What do  they get paid - (now looks over at  girls who offer the  information - $135.37) they pay one hundred thirty-five  dollars and thirty-seven cents to  start.  I got a wife and kids.  I  can't live on that -- You want to  live on that?  What do you make a  week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swiftly, evasive) I'm here to talk to you, Sonny, not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... I'm talkin' to you.   I'm askin' you a question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience is interested in you,  Sonny... not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  We're hot entertainment, right?   You got me and Sal on TV...  we're  entertainment you sell, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're news, Sonny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you have to pay an  entertainer to fill this slot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newsman, not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, newsman.  How much you make a  week? (beat) You're not talkin'.  You payin' me? What have you got for me?  We're  givin' you entertainment... what are  you givin' us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want us to give you? You want to be paid for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be paid.  I'm here  with Sal and eight other people...   and we're dyin'!  They're gonna blow  our guts out, man!  You're gonna see  our brains onna sidewalk!  How's  that for all you shut-ins and  housewives to look at!  You gonna  help, or you just put it on instead  of AS THE WORLD TURNS?  We're dyin'  here!  What have you got for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?  Give up?  You ever been in  prison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then talk about somethin' you fuckin'  know about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that instant, the TV screen switches to a PLEASE STAND card and we hear an announcer's voice over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, our transmission  has been temporarily interrupted.   Please stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny hangs up the phone, looks at Mulvaney, puzzled at t outcome of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell did he do that?  What  the hell did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he didn't appreciate your  use of language.  They don't speak  that way on television.  It's a rule.   Do you realize you've cut off a  valuable source of communication?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny now moves over to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Sal... what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure maybe we can get the FBI to  make a deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can get outta this thing  alive... get 'em to drop the  kidnapping charges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  You talkin' about  coppin a plea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to speak, but  Sal interrupts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because if you're talking about  coppin' a plea, I'm tellin' you right  now, there's no deal... I'm never  going back to prison... We got our  own deal already... Do you remember  the pact we made?  You and me and  Jackie - that night in the bar... we  were talkin' about if we get trapped  in the bank, what are you gonna do...  Right?  What did we say?  What did  we say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd kill ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that still go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not there yet.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE CONTINUES TO RING.
dialogues.text: Sonny now walks over to the ringing phone on Edna's desk. Jenny, sitting on top of the desk, thinks the call is fro her husband, starts to reach for it but as she does, Sonn grabs it away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on the phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them all.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a heavy adhesive voice that can be heard clearly  throughout the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them all now?  You fuckin' creep!   Don't call here again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny slams down the receiver, looks around at the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see what we're dealing with? They want me to kill all of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now, Sonny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... I've been looking  at this all wrong... Let's look at  it the other way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses over to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we gotta get a jet outta here...  outta the country.  We gotta get a  helicopter.  Okay, Sal?  We get a  helicopter on the roof to take us to  the jet and we fly to the sunny  Caribbean.  Algeria.  We got to look  at the bright side.  We got 'em by  the balls, we got the hostages, we  can get anything we want.  They gotta  give it to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna exits ladies room as Sonny crosses back to the phone picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Get me Moretti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Sonny turns and speaks to the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all gonna get outta here. You're all gonna be all right.  I'm  gonna ask for a helicopter and a  jet... and we're gonna get outta  here alive... You've all been all  right with me and as long as it stays  that way, then things are gonna be  all right - as long as you  cooperate... (into phone) Moretti, I want to talk to you.  I'm  comin' out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny slams the phone down and walks over to Sal, rifle s in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize, Sal, that we're gonna  get outta the country, so if you  wanna talk to somebody, do it now...  You gotta Mother or a Father? Friends? (Sal nods no) If we gotta be outside the country,  where do you wanna go?  Any country. Just name a country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopped for a moment) Wyoming... That's not out of the  country -- that's in the United  States... Look, I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny starts to walk toward the door.  As he does, Sal ca back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny!  Gimme the gun.  You don't  need that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny realizes what he's saying and crosses back to Sal a hands him the gun, then moves toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much as before.  Sonny steps out.  The guns start to come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops lower their weapons.  Moretti comes out on the  sidewalk.  He's eating an ice cream bar, and stands seemi at ease, an island of calm control in a storm of passion  about to be let loose.  The Cops are always about to expl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, ya want somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny is about to open his mouth when a medium-size dark- haired Man who has been standing among people behind the  barriers puts his head down and runs at astonishing speed right across the street towards Sonny.  He catches everyb so by surprise he is already on Sonny before anyone can d more than start to yell at him to stop.  Sonny, himself,  can't believe it!  He is slammed to the ground and the Ma begins to punch him and beat him viciously.  Cops charge and with great difficulty pull him off. YELLING on the radio network; TV Reporters and the crowd and SCREAMING for blood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Moretti steps in.  Sonny gets up, dazed.  The Man goes kicking and fighting Cops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney stands in the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Maria's boy friend) Hey!  What the fuck you tryin' to  do?  You don't think the whole police  department can do the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's got Maria in there, and  I see blood, man!  I wanta jam him  up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, the Spanish!  You gotta do it  yourself, right?  Eye for an eye!   Go wan get outa here, we'll take  care of her. (turns to Sonny) You okay, Sonny?  Boy, he hung a  couple good ones on you there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from door; alarmed) Sal wants to see Sonny.  He says  he'll shoot unless he can see Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means Sal.  Sonny, dazed and bleeding, reels to the do and calls in... Sal now stands alone behind 3rd pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to face Moretti, Sylvia, Mulvaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; hurt,  wondering) He wanted to kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, you got a lot of  protection.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Looking around, bewildered, the crowd is YELLING and now sounds unfriendly.  He is really shaken up... He shakes  himself -- stops that line and starts over in a business- like tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a helicopter to get outa here!   And a jet to take us to... (cagey) ...wherever we want to go.  Outa the  country, so no little jets.  A big  one with a bar and a piano lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Sonny.  I don't know  if the helicopters can land in here. I'll have to check it out.  I got  superiors, unnerstan?  They don't  always see eye to eye with me.  I'll  do what I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny looks him in the eye.  Suddenly he makes kissing mo and sounds with his lips.  We know what he's referring to he thinks Moretti's trying to fuck him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sonny, be reasonable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see my wife.  I want you  to bring her down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what do you give me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' doin'.  I give you one hostage  when you bring my wife, and one for  the helicopter, one for the jet, and  the rest can come home on the jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kiss) I'll see what they'll do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny smiles and pantomimes kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you pick out who you're gonna  give us.  Where's your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Heidi.  Her body lies exactly as before, baking i the sun.  The transistor RADIO plays... she seems to be  asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the leader of the pair, a Vietnam  veteran, Sonny Abramowicz, has  demanded in return for releasing one  of the hostages that police allow  his wife to visit him at the bank.   Police spokesman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi sits bolt upright, stares at the radio, which conti to blather on.  Abruptly she begins to gather up her thin her children, in a characteristically scatter-brained and hyperactive sort of way.  Heidi is a one woman panic:  sh hustles away across the broiling sand carrying the radio  wadded up in towels, and lugging a child, crying helpless by one elbow, as though it were a handle, a silhouette ag the late afternoon sun, out of Fellini... meanwhile on th SOUND TRACK we are hearing her voice.  It is a breathless harsh childish voice that pours out the words in a torren

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transistor goes Sonny what?  I  couldn't believe my ears, so I shut  the transistor, get outta here, who  needs this?  I say Sonny didn't do  it.  It's not him to rob a bank. It's not him to hurt anybody, to  threaten anybody, to steal or do  anything wrong.  'Cause he's never  done nothin' wrong from the day I  know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is stumping off into the sunset as she says these wor and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of a subway crowd, she struggles, pulling the two kid by the hand, a very ordinary woman in a most ordinary New York scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Only he tells me this and he tells  me that, he's with the Mafia, I say,  Sonny, where do you get the money,  you're on welfare, how can you rent  a new Eldorado, red, you don't like  the color you rent a yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A working class block, dirty, shops in the first floor, t story walk-ups above... Heidi appears and runs up the sto TWO COPS get out of a squad car where they've been staked out and move up to her.  They never really get in a word  edgewise.  They follow her into the hall... Now as we CUT CLOSER to her, we will SEE Heidi's mouth in SYNC with the words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So night before last we're at Coney  Island, he's on the rides with the  kids, an' I have this habit of goin'  in glove compartments an' all, an' I  see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi struggles up the stairs, dragging the kids -- the c following...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: this gun with bullets in there, an'  I go to myself, oh God, Sonny!  That's  all I had to see, I didn't say  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got her door unlocked.  Below and on the stairs beh the Cops, curious neighbors peer in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos out of cut-rate furniture stores.  Full of unwashed glasses, kids' clutter.  Throughout, the children rush ar unchecked.  Neighbors enter without ceremony and listen. The Cops stand, trying vainly to communicate... As they  enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And things are adding in my head,  how crazy he's been acting, and in  with a bad crowd, an' I look at him,  he's yellin' at the kids like a  madman.  So inna car I said to him,  Sonny, what you gonna do with the  gun?  You gonna shoot me and dump my  body inna river or what?  I was so  scared of him, I never been scared  of Sonny never.  You know, his mother  says the cops was always at our house,  we was always fighting.  I hit him  with the jack in the car once, but I  only missed and hit myself, you should  of seen my leg.  And all he would  ever do is put on his coat and go  out.  So they say it's Sonny but I  don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, you saw him.  You saw his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might of done it, his body  functions might of done it, but not  he himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is now situated like this: 1) MULVANEY'S DESK - the TV is on; seated in his chair, f her nails is MIRIAM. Seated to her left, having pulled the chair a patron uses is MARIA, watching TV and listening to her transistor rad against her left ear, at the same time. MULVANEY (at back water cooler - will eventually move bac to his desk, sit down to Miriam's right.) 2) EDNA - is now behind the Tellers' cages, straightening the mess; she picks up the loose money that Sonny had  scattered thru the air, puts them into packets and ties t with rubber bands. 3) SAL - is seated in the rear Conference room, still hol his rifle, feet up on the table. 4) MULVANEY & DEBORAH - at the rear water cooler (fro she will move to see what's wrong with Margaret) 5) MARGARET - seated at her desk, obviously ill, wiping h forehead, head bowed. 6) SYLVIA and JENNY - at far right table, doing a crosswo puzzle. 7) SONNY - pacing back and forth Mulvaney's desk, posing legal puzzle for Maria. Sonny, his gun now lying across the top of Mulvaney's des is pacing back and forth between the desk areas.  He's ta to Maria in particular, but anyone in earshot in general.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say I put a gun to your head  and I tell you to kill a cop...  and  you did.  Who'd go to the electric  chair... you or me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would... you told me to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining in) But you told her to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - But you did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deborah crosses to Margaret who is ill.  Deborah goes to  Sylvia - who returns with her her to Margaret. It should begin getting dark in through here.  It is very hot and sweaty in the bank.  OPEN SCENE ON:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is sweating, worried.  He is listening to a conversati we can HEAR... as it goes on SHOT WIDENS to reveal the ot in various postures of waiting.  Sal more disheveled, Son restlessness is unabated; he paces about like a caged ani The voice on the phone is breathy and youthful: Sonny has been listening for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ is coming back and he's  really pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Yeah, well I don't blame him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Sonny, I used to dope a  lot, and I was into dipping?  And I  did a couple bank jobs, and the Lord  Jesus in his everlasting mercy saved  me, you know how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny is desperate to get off the phone but doesn't dare  risk the wrath of God by hanging up on this guy.  He migh have the secret after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Look, we're kind of....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I can talk to you, as an  equal, Sonny.  You got to merge your  whole soul with God.  And then you  are Him and one with the Holy Ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... maybe you better talk  to one of these others, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny?  Don't send me away!  I can  help you save your soul ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny hangs up.  Deborah moves to Margaret, who is ill. goes to tell Sylvia who immediately crosses to Margaret. ANGLE ON MARGARET & SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air conditioning is off or something. (Looks at Margaret) she's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny runs around, notices her - sees that air conditione is off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the air conditioning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Sonny... on the roof  somewhere I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (improv. about going  out back to find the  air conditioning  mechanism) Sonny moves toward Sal in the  Conference room.  Mulvaney follows  discreetly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal, I'm gonna take a look at the  air conditioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny and Mulvaney start to move out toward the back door area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mulvaney) Do you think we can turn it on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point, Sal calls out to Sonny, and gets up to mov to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never been up in a plane before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing - it just goes up -  it's the safest thing in the world.   Safer than a car.  Don't worry about  it, Sal - it'll be all right...  they're great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sonny and Mulvaney exit toward rear of bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny and Mulvaney move toward the back door and stop und a trap door in the ceiling.  Mulvaney looks up at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sonny is staring up at the trap door, thinking about w to do, he hears a tiny scratching SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, tensing like an animal, peers around wildly to loc the source of the little scratching SOUND: like mice at a steel door.

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: who quickly runs back toward the desk area.

dialogues.speaker: ON GROUP
dialogues.text: Sonny races back in, grabs the gun from atop Mulvaney's d and with the cartridge in the other hand, runs back towar the back door again, jamming cartridge into rifle. At this point, Sal runs in from the Conference room, cove everyone point-blank again, yelling for Edna to join the  rest of the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) They're trying to come through the  door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Edna) Everybody!  Back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna quickly obeys, moving quickly to the rest of the gro

dialogues.speaker: ON BACK DOOR AREA
dialogues.text: as Sonny races toward Mulvaney and back door with gun.

dialogues.speaker: MULVANEY
dialogues.text: Somebody or something is working on the other side of the door!

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: as he moves back from the door, turns and levels the rifl on the back door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, if you shoot, shoot high...   my car's parked out there.

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: staring at the door.  He hears the continued scratching n and might even see the door knob move. Abruptly he swings the rifle up so the bullet going throu will clearly go over the head of any man, out through the transom. He FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: They all scream, some of them falling to the floor, huddl together in terror.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Sonny races back into main area where Sal covers group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to group) Get over here!  Get over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knot of half a dozen police are working at the door.  T were trying to work tubes under it to pump in gas, others were trying a nylon line to the doorknob, the idea being  that if Sonny came out that way, the moment he began to o the door the cops would yank it open, exposing him comple and gun him down.  The cops SCREAM as the SHOT comes thro the door, showering them with brick fragments.  They scra over cars, over each other, over fences, running into oth cops, who also, not knowing what's happening, turn and fl running into the crowd, which panics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on men, women, children, cops, detectives, dogs, cats,  reporters, all in the area of the rear of the bank fleein in waves over fences, cars, etc.  A flood of people like  lemmings.  This is INTERCUT BY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) MARGARET fainting. 2) SAL herds group into vault area. 3) SONNY dashing back and forth into rear bank area.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER SHOP
dialogues.text: Moretti, Sheldon, others come charging out, wondering wha the hell, pulling guns out.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF BANK
dialogues.text: The cops, safely distanced and back in cover, peek out at

dialogues.speaker: BANK DOOR
dialogues.text: It is okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?  He shot through  the door.  Is he coming out?  Can  you see in... (Etc., etc.)

dialogues.speaker: ON MORETTI
dialogues.text: reaches out his hand for a bullhorn that is thrust into i immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on bullhorn) Sonny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few louts in the crowd yell out in imitation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echoing) Sonny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti shrugs off his irritation and raises the bullhorn one more time: the crowd is ready and SCREAMS in unison a Moretti says: MORETTI & CROWD Sonny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could hear it for a half a mile! Sonny starts to yell at Moretti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inside bank) What the hell you doin' back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, come on out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny walks over to Sal, gives him the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal, watch 'em... I'm goin' out.

dialogues.speaker: BANK
dialogues.text: as Sonny comes charging out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tryin' to fuck me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not tryin' to fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what were they doin'?  You're  tellin' me you had nothin' to do  with that back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God I had nothing to do  with it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit... I don't walk to talk to  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... everything you asked  for is on the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is on its way... The helicopter can't  land but we got a bus... the jet's  on its way to Kennedy... we got a  bus coming here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're full of shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, your wife's on the way...  We  reached her... your wife's on the  way... everything you asked for, you  got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what were you doin' back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't happen again... I'll do  everything I can to stop anything I  can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're telling me that a  helicopter can't land here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't land... you'd kill people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not... I'm not... you're gettin'  a bus... you're gettin' a bus... the  jet's comin' into Kennedy... and  your wife's on the way... what else  do you need?  What else can I get  you?  Listen, I don't know how you  can do better...  see that man over  there... the FBI guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one more explosion like that  and you're gonna see a dead body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be... there won't be...  What else do you need?  How else can  we help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
