dialogues.text: All right... I got some hungry people  in there... I want to get some  pizza... some stuff like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cokes, seven-ups... (Moretti repeats) also some aspirin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspirins... okay you got it. (turns behind him to  a near-by cop) Charlie!  Six pizzas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny turns and walks back into the bank.

dialogues.speaker: SAL WITH THE GROUP
dialogues.text: as Sonny enters and walks toward Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... okay... all right, Sal, it's  okay.  I got everything straightened  out... it's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I talked to him and it's not  going to be a helicopter - they can't  land on top of the roof - so they're  comin' with a big...  limousine bus  and they'll take us to the airport -  and they're gonna get a jet... so  things are rollin'...  They're  movin'... I also ordered some food...  I got some pizzas for us, all right?   I got some things to drink - I got  sodas... I even asked them for  aspirins... I'm doin' what I can...  now I gotta pay for the pizza...  where are the marked bills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He now walks behind Tellers' cages and picks up some of t decoy money that Edna had started to clean up and re-stac Mulvaney walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to get the ball rolling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  What do  you think I'm doin'?  I'm gettin'  the ball rollin'.  I'm keeping these  people happy... I'm keeping you  happy... I gotta keep the cops cooled  out... I gotta do everything... I  gotta pay for the pizza .. I'm workin'  on it, do you know what I mean?  I'm  workin' on it... Jesus Christ!  I  gotta do it all... I got all the  ideas... you want me to give you the  gun?  You want to take it over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny walks to the front door with the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny appears in it.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL THE DELIVERY BOY
dialogues.text: guarded by a couple of cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the guy wanted the pizza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny grabs bills from the wad he holds and thrusts them him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's paid for. (looks at Moretti;  Moretti nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the change...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cops reach for the money, knowing it's bank money, people in the crowd yell:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, over here!  Hey, robber!  How  about a thousand!  Throw some over  here!  Hey, no shit, I need an  operation, I don't even have a job... (Etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny holds up the money.  The crowd cheers.  He throws t wad of bills and it scatters in the air. The WIND is blowing now.  Even some cops join the ensuing melee to gather it up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as cops move forward and try to catch the bills.  Some bl into the crowd.  Fights break out in the crowd as they  scramble for the money.  The crowd breaks the barriers an swarms after the cash.  Cops try to retrieve bills; fist  fights, arrests.

dialogues.speaker: MORETTI
dialogues.text: staring at the mess. Sonny also watching the people. There is in both of them the same reaction of faint disgu at the greed unleashed.  Sonny angrily hurls another bund after the first... then laughs as he watches the people  fighting. Moretti nods ironically at him.  Sonny turns and enters t bank with the food.  The fighting goes on in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny enters carrying food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay - Chow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts it down in front of Mulvaney, on Mulvaney's desk. Mulvaney looks at it, sickly.  As Mulvaney looks up at So

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You eat it first.  I don't know if  they put something in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti, Sheldon, other top cops march fast-time toward t barrier where uniformed cops stand around a limousine tha has drawn up to the barrier.  It is full of white-haired  officials, one of them the COMMISSIONER.  He has a voice  broken by whiskey, cigars, good food and yelling at footb games. DOLLY AT A LOW DRAMATIC ANGLE WITH MORETTI AND ETC. It looks like they may be going into action.  Moretti's  attitude is not that subtly different now he's talking to brass.  Commissioner doesn't get out; he talks through wi The Commissioner's hand, pudgy and freckled with age, cov Moretti's where it rests on the door: he massages Moretti hand fondly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene -- you smilin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I never smile any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whattaya think: we gonna kill any  civilians tonight, Gene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never make bets or guesses, that  way I'm never wrong and I never have  to pay out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene, Jesus, what a bull he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of comfortable CHUCKLES inside the limo.  The  Commissioner's hand lingers on Moretti's -- they are fond each other, these men, linked in a relationship of a life of shared experience, of attitudes, of maleness -- an  accumulation of years of jokes about being late for dinne of women waiting and women panting with desire, men secur in the bastion of their roles.  What is being passed on h is a purely emotional force of approval and acceptance fr top to bottom of a social institution that is the last to masculine society: police.  The homosexual content of thi should not be lost: it lies in the comfortable fit of the feelings, in the fact, simply, that they love each other, for what they share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whatsa deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jet's comin' out.  But don't  let 'em off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we gotta kill a whole lot of  people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let 'em off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans down to get close to his commissioner, because h not fooled by the camaraderie into a false sense of secur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anticipating) If you're right I'm gonna back you a  hundred percent, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) Fuck you, sir - if I'm right, I don't need you.  What I want is - if I make an honest mistake I want  help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commissioner nods - presses a button and the window g up to keep the air conditioning in and the heat out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as we hear Jenny on the phone with her husband.  Sonny is doing the manual of arms with his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...well, just pick him up and hold  him.  No, he's not spoiled, he's  just got to settle his stomach after  eating.  He's used to me feeding me,  that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At one point, Sonny starts to show Miriam how to hold the gun and in mock seriousness, she tries to do the manual o arms.

dialogues.speaker: WE DRIFT TOWARD THE BACK CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: where Sal is seated at the Conference table, rifle on the table.  Edna and Sylvia are also seated there.  Maria ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody give me a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria walks over to her, offering her one, then remembers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylvia, you don't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never smoked before in my life but  I got a right to start now if I want  to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't smoke... why do you want  to start now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm scared, that's why. You never smoked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to, but I stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stopped?  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't want cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want cancer?  You're about  to get your head blown off, you're  worried about cancer. (to Maria) Gimme the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria starts to hand one to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I'm not kidding.  Don't you  understand?  You're pure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't start now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake!  As soon as I'm outta  this bank robbery, I'm gonna stop...  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  Do what you want to do.   I hate to see you break a perfect  record.  You oughta take care of  your body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My body?  What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your body is the temple of the Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at him) You're serious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really pure, you know?  You  got a perfect record.  You never  used that stuff to ruin your body,  why start now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you remind me of my 19- year-old brother - only he's got his  hair down to his knees - he looks  like something that eats berries and  roots out of the ground.  God forbid  I should say something to him like,  'Listen, if you ever smoke marijuana,  just remember that it's illegal' and  he storms outta the house.  You rob  a bank, but you keep your body pure,  is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna smoke the cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal gets up and starts to leave the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to him) Sal... If I die of cancer it's going  to be half your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylvia grabs the cigarette from Maria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exiting) No - it's because you're weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny continues with "Manual of Arms" business with rifle Mulvaney is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping Janet  into phone) Mulvaney... (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sonny) It's for you.  Moretti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny takes the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're bringing in your wife...

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: He comes alert, looks around at Sal, nods, and starts for the door of the bank, turns to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives him gun) They've got my wife.  They're bringing  her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits bank.  Sal walks toward the door, stops behind t first post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire escape with the old lady and her jigsaw puzzle, flak vested snipers, etc.  Below in the street a police c plows through the crowd with red lights flashing but no s or perhaps just a low growl to help move the human sea as People are leaning over trying to see inside.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER SHOP
dialogues.text: Moretti and Sheldon and staff move out into the street. cop car is moving through police lines, cops lifting  barricades aside to let it pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Moretti and others as they move to intercept the pol car where it will stop on the corner.  As they stop, we c see Sonny step into the door of the bank, in the distance He is greeted with CHEERS from the crowd.  But is intent the car. We are NOW SHOOTING ACROSS THE CAR, OVER MORETTI'S BACK T THE BANK and Sonny. The DRIVER of the police car gets out, with a huge grin o his face and nods to Moretti.  The back door opens and an cop gets out, also grinning.  They look around toward Son as his wife gets out of the police car, on this side.  Sh is spectacularly good looking in a lithe cruel sort of wa like Lauren Bacall, but right now she is a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny sees Leon get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon!  Leon!  Over here!  Happy  Birthday, Leon!

dialogues.speaker: ON LEON
dialogues.text: who doesn't hear Sonny calling, the detectives and Morett start to take him to the barbershop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cop driver) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went to the hospital, where he  told us - and asked for his wife. He... (indicates Leon) ...says they got married in a church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue along the sidewalk.  Leon, coming to, start to look around him.  He sees Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: as he yells again to Leon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon!  Happy Birthday!

dialogues.speaker: ON LEON
dialogues.text: who faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd yelling in increasing waves of SOUND; Moretti a cops pick up Leon and rush him toward the barbershop.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: who dashes toward the bank door, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny comes running in.  Sylvia is now showing off her new-found expertise with a cigarette to Miriam, Jenny and Deborah, seated around Edna's desk.  (Deborah is talking the phone.)  Meanwhile, Edna is back in the Conference Ro with Mulvaney; Margaret is seated at her desk, speaking o the phone; Maria, speaking on phone, is seated at Mulvane desk - where television is still on. Sonny, wanting to use a phone, realizes that all are in u rushes to a desk at the front of the bank.  Sal follows h there.  Sonny grabs a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Get me Moretti!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Moretti and cops are trying to revive Leon.  A cop the phone turns to Moretti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti - he wants to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti walks over to phone, takes receiver from cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny waiting for Moretti to answer phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he all right?  Is he all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all doped up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's groggy, Sonny.  Let me get him  on his feet and he'll call you back. (hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Moretti hangs up phone and walks over to Leon, who now has a glass of water and a cold towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon?  Whatsa matter?  They give you  a shot down the hospital or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, they shot me with like  unreal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you got to get hold of yourself.   You got to talk to him, tell him to  give himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got eight people in there with  him.  He's got this kid with him...   they're gonna shoot the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it.  I can't stop him  from anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he won't listen to you, who will  he listen to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't listen to anybody.  He's  been very crazy all summer.  Since  June he's been trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try calling the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good is that?  They couldn't  stop him.  And it'd just make him  mad.  They don't know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's got to stop him, Leon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was under great strain: you don't  understand, he's a very mixed up  person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's makin' threats in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's scared.  It's crazy.  I never  met anyone like him.  His wife, he's  a wonderful father to his children.   His mother - you should see her -  his mother and father together are  like a bad car wreck - he lets it  all slide off his back, he sees them,  he pays their rent.  Unbelievable.   I wanted to get married... He didn't  really want it... he's married  already!  But he did it.  I don't  know why.  I thought it would help  me, but it didn't.  I was just as  confused and unhappy was before; I  did terrible things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of things, Leon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten days I spent in Atlantic City -  Sonny was frantic - he knew I was  drinking; he didn't know where I  was... who I was with.  I couldn't  explain why I did the things I did.   So I went to this psychiatrist who  explained to me I was a woman in a  man's body.  So Sonny right away  wanted to get me money for a sex  change operation: but where was he  to get that?  2500 dollars!  My God,  he's in hock up to his ears already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needed money?  For the operation  for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It made him crazy - so much demand,  he'd fly into this rages.  And I got  more depressed than ever; I saw I'd  never get the operation.  So I tried  to take my life - I swallowed about  a half pound of pills...  blues,  reds, yellows, downers, uppers,  screamers... you name it.  But I  just threw them up and wound up in  the hospital.  Sonny comes there and  looks at me and just says: 'Wow!'   So when I hear he's in the bank, I  almost go crazy because I know he's  doin' it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't you figure you owe to  him to get him out of there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in it up to your ass, Leon. You're an accessory.  You talk him  out of there and they might be a  little more understanding of your  case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he gonna hurt you on the  telephone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say to him.  I  can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it over, Leon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti walks over to the wall phone, picks up the receiv and waits to be connected with the bank and Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: ON LEON
dialogues.text: Terrified.  He really can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: ON MORETTI
dialogues.text: waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the phone rings.  Sonny picks it up, hears Moretti's v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't talk to you.  Let me work  on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny hangs up.  He and Sal walk toward the group at the  rear, around the desks.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION SCREEN
dialogues.text: as we see TV newsman speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...police are questioning Leon, a  year-old admitted homosexual, who  claims to have been married to one  of the bank robbers in a ceremony  last November... [etc.]...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the speech, Sylvia and her group wander toward  Mulvaney's desk to listen, as Edna wanders down from the  Conference Room, crosses to the set and turns up the volu

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: pacing back and forth.  They all stare at him.  Slowly th group shifts to other positions, without a word being sai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our coverage of the Brooklyn robbery  where two homosexuals are holding  hostages for their demands of a  helicopter, a jet, and safe passage  out of the country...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep sayin' two homosexuals.   I'm not a homosexual.  I want you to  stop them saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all they're interested in -  it's a freak show to them.  I can't  control it, Sal - let'em say what  they want.  Forget it.  It don't  matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the god-damn jet?  They're  always flying overhead - going  somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI snipers area at positions, waiting.  A small group of men make a last check.  A signal is given.  They get in t car and drive away.  An FBI sniper lights a cigarette and settles down to wait, moving his rifle to a comfortable  position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old lady dozes over her puzzle.  The police agents ar being relieved.  Light floods the front of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny paces back and forth (with ad-lib dialogue to group Margaret, seated at her desk, has feet up on another chai while Jenny sits on top of her desk.  Mulvaney is back at water cooler, starting to feel very ill.  Miriam and Debo are seated at Mulvaney's desk.  Edna is seated at her des while Sylvia sits on top of desk, talking on phone. Suddenly, the lights go out, leaving only emergency light on (4 in the main area and 2 at back door area).  Sylvia  immediately moves over toward the vault area and turns on hand lamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both rush toward the front of the bank.  They see that ev the flood lights are now out, but across the street can s be seen lights in the store windows.  Sonny rushes to a n by phone to try to reach Moretti, but even the phones are dead.  They hear Moretti's voice over a bull-horn outside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny... Sonny... Come out a minute...  Come out a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny moves toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti and Sheldon are in the barbershop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all set at Kennedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think you'll be able  to control it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's totally unstable.  He'll make a  mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't so far.  I'm the one who  can make a mistake.  That's what  scares the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene, at 3:07, this became Federal.   Why don't I take it over now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the door opens and Sonny peeks out, the once-illuminat floodlights now out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moretti?  What the fuck is goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no answer.  Sonny steps out into the street.  He  can't see anything anymore.  The atmosphere is suddenly  chillingly dangerous: the crowd SHOTS "come out of the da and "we can't see from here".  The street seems empty exc for a few threatening silhouettes of heavily-armed cops. Sonny responds with bluster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the lights back on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out farther into the street.  From behind him,  SHELDON, the FBI man, approaches.  He is alone.  Unsmilin Sonny dashes back into the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny rushes in, warns Sal about the FBI confrontation he's about to have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal - it's the FBI... I'm goin' back  out to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this, he walks back toward the door and exits the bank again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon is walking toward Sonny as the latter exits the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?  The FBI?  Jesus, now  we're talkin', maybe we can get this  thing moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sheldon reaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off, get the lights back on  and the air conditioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing ID) No more favors.  That's all over,  Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Aw, Jesus... you been doin' us favors  all night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a jet.  I'll have airport  limousine here in a half hour.  I  want the hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to work with you on this,  not against you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny comes around, looking for Moretti: can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Jesus, these hostages are  keeping me alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, when do I get them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the airport.  We get on the plane,  check it out, and if it's all okay  we'll send them out.  Except one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to Leon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause, while Sheldon thinks this over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to come in, and see if  everybody's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got guts.  You think if Sal and  me have cut their throats we're gonna  let you out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny re-enters bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny goes over to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the FBI.  He wants to come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have him walk in backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny exits bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny crosses to Sheldon, grins, grabs him and executes a very professional-looking pat-down search. He removes Sheldon's .38 from a shoulder holster, produci it for the crowd with a flourish like a magician: some of the old playfulness returns for a moment.  He carefully a with showbiz flourishes searches Sheldon's thighs and gro The crowd HOWLS.  Sheldon bears it with stoic calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny stands up from the search and finds Sheldon's ey locked to his with flat calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you'd like to kill me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't like to, but I will, if I  have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' personal, huh?  The man that  kills me, I want him to do it because  he hates my guts.  Not because it's  a job.  Okay, let's go... but you  gotta walk in backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The move toward the door of the bank, where Sonny opens t door, preceding Sheldon, both men entering backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for the 4 emergency lights, it is very dark - and  very hot as Sonny and Sheldon enter the bank.  Sal now st behind the desks, covering Sheldon and the group assemble at the vault.  Sheldon takes in every detail as he walks  toward the group in the rear, followed closely and covere by Sonny.  As they near the desks, Sonny yells out an ord for the group:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody give their right name...   it's the FBI!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to see all you young  ladies are all all right in here.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA AND SAL
dialogues.text: She's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, we asked for the jet hours  ago, what are you doin' out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon is watching Sal, trying to gauge him.  This is th first time anyone from outside has seen Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his eyes on Sal) It's all being set up, we'll have  you out of here in a couple of hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheldon) Just give them what they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon now walks closer to group, looking into the two s examining rooms as he moves.  Sonny covers him every inch the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting what they want.  We  just want to be sure we get what we  want, which is to get all you ladies  out safe.  And you two boys, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon is now standing very close to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheldon) You got to talk to the TV, tell them  to stop talking about the two  homosexuals.  I'm not gay...  that's  the truth.  Tell 'em that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. (he turns to Sonny) Sonny?  Outside for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gotta stop sayin' that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they (Sheldon and Sonny) exit and stand in the doorway out of earshot of the others.  Sheldon is matter-of-fact, but insinuating and conspiratorial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, you handled yourself real  well.  A lot of men would have choked,  and we'd have a lot of chaos and  panic and maybe a death or a multiple  death on our hands, but you handled  it.  I respect that.  Don't you try  to take Sal.  We'll handle him.  You  just sit tight and you won't get  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to go.  Sonny grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute!  What the fuck you  tryin' to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) What I said.  You just sit quiet and  we'll handle Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he turns and starts to walk away, leaving Sonny stari after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sheldon steps into the door.  The place is jammed, Mor stands inside the door where Sonny could not have possibl seen him.  Sheldon quietly turns and stands beside him, b men looking back across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little bastard miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon smiles the supercilious Ehrlichman smile of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny re-enters.  He's restless, hyperactive, constant moving during this scene; a man with a potentially guilty conscience.  Sal moves toward him and both men walk to ar in front of the Tellers' cages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was talkin' about arrangements...  we were talkin' about the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why couldn't he talk about that here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was showin' me how the airport  bus is comin' in, like that, Sal. (notices Mulvaney  start to faint) What's wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the rear, Mulvaney slumps into a chair beside Margaret desk.  Sylvia rushes to help him, untying his tie, etc.   Maria runs into the Conference room, hoping to find remai of sugar as Deborah crosses to his desk, looking through drawers for medication.  Jenny simply can't cope with it walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got diabetes.  He's not a well  person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those bastards -- they poisoned the  pizza!  Sal - you didn't eat any  pizza!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't eat any pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, he's got diabetes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to balance your sugar  diet, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny starts to move toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny rushes outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Is there a doctor over there? Get him over here!  Come on, on the  double!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon and a young DOCTOR appear, concerned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager, he's diabetic, he's  lookin' bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon turns, calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man comes forward - is frisked by Sonny, who then dumps contents of his Black Bag and looks for weapons.  Sonny t dashes inside bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny comes in, walks over to Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal - the Doctor's coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny then rushes back outside bank again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny crosses to Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doctor) You go on in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor hustles past.  HOLD on Sheldon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up the phone) I've convinced Leon to talk to you. He's on the phone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny rushes back into Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny rushes in.  The phone rings.  He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  Hello, Leon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'm out of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased) Yeah.  You said... I thought you  were never getting out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought I'd get out this  way.  I'll tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooohh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... huh... how you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really shakey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know... Moretti told me  before that you were drugged up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It was terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That... huh... they just shoot you  with drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come in and they say, right away,  that you are crazy.  And they start  putting things in your arm...  you  know.  How do they expect you to get  uncrazy if you're asleep all the  time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't talk or do anything.  You  really feel... you know... I'm just  sort of coming out of it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pensive) So... that sure is something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  So how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Fine, thank you.  I'm in trouble. That is... now I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Yeah... I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'm gonna do...   you know.  Boy... I'm dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What are you talking about? You are dying?  Did you ever listen  to yourself when you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean... what am I talking  about?  Do you realize that you say  that to me every day of your life?   I am dying.  Do you know... do you  realize the death that you are  spreading around to the people who  are around you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't give me that deep shit  now.  Don't start with that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really... I don't think that you  realize what it means.  The things  that you do, Sonny.  You put a gun  to somebody's head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Yeah... obviously you don't... when  you put a gun to somebody's head...   and you say go to sleep so that it  won't hurt when I pull the trigger. Death?  Don't talk about death to  me.  I have been living with death  for the last six months.  Why do you  think I'm in the hospital?  I take a  handful of pills to get away from  you.  And then here I am out of the  hospital talking to you on the  phone... again.  I have no friends  left.  No job.  I can't live.  I  have to live with people.  This death  business... I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not on the phone to talk to you  about that.  Well, I don't know what  to say, Leon.  When you gimme that...  when you hit me with that shit.  I  mean, what am I supposed to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indifferent to Sonny) I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.  That I got a lot of  pressures.  You said to me that you  needed money, and I knew that you  needed money!  I saw you there lying  in the hospital like that...  and I  said... shit, man, I got to get this  guy some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) But I didn't ask you to go rob a  bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting louder) All right.  I know you didn't ask  me.  You didn't ask me but I did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it on my own.  I did this all  on my own.  I ain't laying it on  anybody.  Nothing on anybody.  I'll  tell you something, though, it's  about time that I squared away my  accounts... you know.  I am squaring  away my accounts with life.  Maybe  this whole thing is gonna end,  somehow.  Maybe it'll just end! Maybe I'll just close my eyes and  the whole fucken thing will be over.   That would be all right too!  I  said... I thought I would square it  away with you... you know?  That I  would get you down here and that I  would say so long to you... or, if  you wanted... you know, to take a  trip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting out of here, man.  I'm  not going to stay here and I'm not  giving up.  I mean, huh, they're  going to kill me, anyway.  So fuck  it!  But, if I can get out of this...  I am going to get out.  And, how I'm  going to do it is to get a jet out  of here and I'm flying the fuck out...  That's all, Leon.  If you want to  come with me, then you're entitled...  you can come.  You're free to do  what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm free to do what I want?  And you  think I would want to go with you  some place on a plane?  Where? Where ya going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta jet coming here and we're  gonna try to get the fuck outta this  thing.  And we're gonna go, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck knows?  I think we're  gonna go... we worked it out to  Algeria.  So, I don't know.  So I'll  go to Algeria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you going to Algeria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh... I don't know.  They got Howard  Johnson's there.  I don't know why  the fuck I'm going there for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard Johnson's... you're warped. You know that?  You're really warped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.  I'm warped... I'm  warped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stuttering) God, Algeria!  Do you know there's a  bunch of... they walk around there...  God!  People walk around with masks  and things on their heads.  They're  a bunch of crazy people there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitchy) I don't know... you could have picked  a better place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denmark?  Sweden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased) I like that... yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal wanted to go to Wyoming.  I told  him it wasn't a country.  We gotta  get outta the country!  To hell with  a guy who doesn't know where Wyoming  is.  Okay.  Can you imagine what  kind of a shape I'm in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter from both Sonny and Leon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So!  Sal is with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal?  Yeah... Sal is with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... wow!  Sonny, you're really  into one mess now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I am.  I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making fun of Sonny) Sal... Sal... Naturale, oh boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't going out.  And if I go out  he's just gonna kill the people.   There's a lot of lives that I'm  responsible for... that's all.  So,  I can't do anything.  I got myself  into this mess and I'll get myself  out of it... the best way I know  how!  One of the ways is not giving  up.  I'm telling ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you do something for me? Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys that got me down here,  you know, huh... they think that I'm  part of this whole thing.  They think  I'm part of the plot to rob the bank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did they think that?  What are  they... crazy?  What do you mean. That's bullshit, Leon.  They're giving  you a fucken story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... they told me that I was an  accomplice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... they're fucken crazy.  That's  a snow job.  Don't listen to that  shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta listen to it if they think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't survive in prison, Sonny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Then what do you want me  to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, would you please just tell  them... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they now?  Just tell me...   are they on the phone now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meekly) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) That's great.  Just terrific.  You  talk to me with them on the phone,  right?  That is really smart.  And,  you don't tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  They're standing all around me. Seven thousand fucken cops... all  around me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... who's on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... don't throw that on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's on the phone, now?  What do  you mean... throw it on you?  You  knew it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I knew it.  But, what choice  do I have?  I'm in the hospital;  they drag me out of the hospital...  bring me down here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, enough!  Who the fuck is  on the phone... anyway?  Is that you  Moretti? (angrily into phone) You on the phone?  Will somebody  talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they on the phone still?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still angry) All right!  He didn't do it.  All  right?  Now... would you get the  fuck off the phone?  I'll bet that  really changed them, huh? (calmly to Leon) Anyway, Leon... did I do it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... huh, thank you.  I'm going  to go back, Sonny, to the hospital. They're really nice people.  They're  really trying to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good then.  You've found  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I don't know if I have or  not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still want the operation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moody) Yeah... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my only chance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say to ya!  I  guess I just wanted to say I'll see  ya... or whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you much... and huh, bon voyage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  See you sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... see ya in my dreams, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I'll write a song.  Ha, ha. I don't know.  Life is funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said a mouthful... sweetheart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny hangs up, walks back toward rear of bank and picks receiver again on Edna's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) You cut off incoming, gimme a line. I want to talk to my wife, I want to  say goodbye to my kids. (line is connected,  he begins to dial;  anguished; to the  group) Here I am, I could call, and they'd  put anybody on the phone, the Pope,  an astronaut, the wisest of the wise  and who do I have to call? (to phone; as she  answers) Heidi?

dialogues.speaker: HEIDI'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: The TV is on, the kids up and racing around, neighbors po beer -- An event!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone; excited) Hey, Sonny!  I'm watchin' it on TV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know, I sent them to the  neighbors.  Sonny, Jesus, it's not  like you.  I can't believe, because  you never hurt anybody since the day  I knew you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi, I'm dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (oblivious) I blame myself, Sonny.  I notice you  been tense, like something is  happening; the night before last  you're yellin' at the kids like a  madman, believe me.  And then you  wanted me to go on this ride with  the kids, this caterpillar about  from here to there - fulla one-year- old kids.  It's ridiculous.  I'm not  about to go on this ride, so you  yell right there, 'You pig, get on  the fuckin' ride!' Well, everything  fell outta - me - my heart, my liver  fell to the floor - you name it!   Yellin' at me in front of all those  people.  Because you never talked  and I never been scared of you, never.   I think: he's gonna shoot me and  dump my body in the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi, for Christ sake, shut up! Will you shut your fucking mouth and  listen?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (afraid) See?  You're screaming with the  language and all!  A person can't  communicate with you.  You become a  stranger in your own home...

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: he sits, dispiritedly listening to this rap: seeing her i clear and unambiguous light as before he saw Leon: what a waste to live in the company of people like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because you hurt me, God how you  hurt me.  Can you imagine, marrying  another man?  Did I do something to  make you do that?  Did I ever turn  you down, or anything?  The only  thing I couldn't do, you're gonna  laugh, is go on top - I got this  fear of high places! (giggles) And I let myself get fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call yourself fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can't stand me to say I'm  fat.  Like I can't stand you being a  bank robber.  I guess that's what  love is -- huh, Sonny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Heidi - why didn't you come down  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus - what - I'm afraid - I'm gonna  get shot or whatever.  You oughta  see it on TV, the guns, the cops,  they got cannon, machine guns, they're  loaded with gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not after you, they're after  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, it's late already when I  realize it's not just a couple of  ordinary faggots, it's just you and  Sal.  I couldn't get a baby sitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi goes on and on, but Sonny just drops the phone on t hook.  As he walks toward the rear of the bank, Sylvia, s atop Margaret's desk, gets off and follows Sonny toward t Conference room.  At the same time, Edna is lifting Marga feet up onto a chair and Jenny and Deborah start to walk  toward the Conference room, too.  Maria paces back and fo transistor to her ear. Sonny walks into the Conference room.  The doctor is thro examining Mulvaney.  Miriam is seated across the table fr him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen - I think I better take him  back for a cardiac check ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney waves, protesting.  He's had a shot; he's rapidl recovering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything... what's wrong?  Is he  gonna die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay... I'm okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know more than the Doctor? You're not okay, look at you.  Come  on... (to Doctor) ...let's get him out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going.  I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sonny grabs him to try to help him up, Mulvaney wrench away.  A little physical here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  I'm tryin' to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stay here.  Damn it.  I just needed  the insulin.  I'm used to it. Go on.  Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doctor) You tell me.  Is he endangering his  health, because if you tell me he  is, I'll get him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be God damned if you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus!  You want to be a martyr  or a hero or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria and Miriam dance to transistor's music.  Edna walks into Conference Room to tidy up.  Sal is still sitting th Deborah tries to comfort Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanta be either, I just want  to be left alone.  You understand  that?  I wish the fuck you never  came in my bank, that's all, don't  try to act like you're some angel of  human kindness! (he crosses toward  Tellers' cages to  start straightening  up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny nods, staring at him.  As Doctor moves toward front door Sonny walks with him.  Grabs marked bills and stuffs them into the Doctor's pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, my man.  Whattayou get for a  house call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Doctor tries to wave it away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) No, no!  I want a top specialist for  my friend, I expect to pay top money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hustled him to the door, where he ushers him out doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hastily made, about 40 feet long, being raised above the  heads of crowd to where Sonny can see it.  We can't read until it's all the way up.  Then is reads: WE LOVE YOU LOVE YOU SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the crowd reads it, fist fights break out and it totte and staggers, but the defenders fight bravely... They are ordinary looking people -- not freaks...

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: looking at it, at them with mixed feelings.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHELDON
dialogues.text: standing across the street looking at him.  Sheldon indic his watch.  Holds up ten fingers: "ten minutes"...

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: He turns into the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny comes back into bank, his face mad with pain.  He w over to Sylvia, standing at open gate of Tellers'  Cages, and brings out a wallet with pictures for her to see. She takes it, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kids... Kimmy and Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over toward Mulvaney, now behind the Tellers' C trying to tidy up, and walks over to show him the picture Sonny stands on the other side of the cages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Mulvaney looks at  pictures) I'll never see them again, Mister  Mulvaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look like good kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like any others but they're  special to me.  You got kids?  You  told me; you got two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special to me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure - we like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem like a likable enough guy. It's hard to judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny walks back toward Sal, who is seated in Conference  Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sal... How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny crosses back downstage again to Mulvaney and Sylvia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to Sal) You know, I don't know him very well -  but he's not gay... and he's not  going back to prison...  One time  when he was in prison, they gang- banged him; 13 years old and eight  guys gave it to him...  So Sal isn't  goin' back to prison, no way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... I like you people... I really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We like you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know - I had a job once.  I used  to work in a bank.  I had been  training... I used to have a boss...  Mr. Don Frio... he wore a toupee...  I wonder if you'd hire me if I came  in here and asked you for a job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I hire you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny walks back toward Sal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you -- they're sending a jet. It's all worked out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But doubt hangs in the air like a pall...

dialogues.speaker: SAL
dialogues.text: looking at him.  Implacable.  This tension between them o the question of Sonny's loyalty must be kept constantly a with CUTS and looks, over dialogue... SYLVIA & MULVANEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody give me another cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal turns to look at her reproachfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish somebody would tell me I'm  gonna live long enough for it to be  a habit.  My parent, she'll be okay. My husband, he'll be okay.  I even  know who the bum is gonna marry.   Terrific.  She'll take good care of  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls, I wanta apologize.  For my  language back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embarrassed, he walks toward the rest of group in the rea stands by Edna's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies... I want to apologize for my  language back there. (he walks over to his  desk, sits down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny exits Conference Room and moves downstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) What'd you say?  I didn't hear you  say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said the 'F' word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at her incredulously. Someone giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 'F' word.  He did.  He said the  'F' word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna crosses to her desk - disgusted - and starts to tidy up. The giggle catches the edge of their panic and anxiety an sweeps them into uncontrollable giggles and laughter: Son roars.  Sal and Edna alone remain unsmiling.  After a few seconds they force themselves to stop, to behave like the should under the circumstances.  They are gasping and cry Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm a Christian, and my ears  are not garbage cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sets them off again.  They howl and giggle and laugh. Until at last they run down again.  At this point, Sal ru out of Conference Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has seen something in the middle of the street, and no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they all turn to look out through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backlighted by the floodlights in the middle of street  escorted by Sheldon, stands a figure, dumpy and gray,  tentatively waving, a figure that bends over baby carriag in the park, picks beans one by one out of supermarket bi lip reads get-well cards in pharmacies. They hear Sheldon, outside, on bullhorn:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny!  Could you come out, please? Could you come out, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my mother.  Who needs this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as a dutiful son he starts for the front of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sonny walks to his MOTHER.  Baker tactfully moves away leaving the two of them in the center of the floodlighted street.  Again the crowd can be HEARD but not seen; armed police fringe the lights and shadows, in B.G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want here, Ma?  You could  of watched it on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Sonny - you oughtta see - - Alla Brooklyn is here!  On all 3  networks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom - I got it all worked out; it's  over.  The best thing is you go home.   Watch it on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to the FBI, I told them  about you, they said if you just  come outta the bank it's gonna be  okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did what?  Who did you talk to? What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm only trying to get you  outta this.  I told them you were in  Vietnam, you always had good jobs,  you were with Goldwater at the '64  convention, but you had marital  problems...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you were never a faggot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to them anymore.  Sal and  me are getting a jet, we're going to  Algeria - I'll write you from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was very understanding - you ought  to talk to him... Algeria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  I don't understand.  If  you needed money, why couldn't you  come to me?  Everything I got is  yours.  I got two hundred and maybe  twenty-five in the savings.  It's  yours.  You know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny abruptly realizes he is getting sidetracked by Mom like always.  Tries to get it back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom - they're sending a bus to take  us to the airport.  You understand? If you're here - they're not gonna  send it.  They'll think I'm gonna  come out with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with that?  The FBI was  very understanding when I explained  it to him.  Everybody knows it isn't  you... It's the pressures from your  home life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake don't start in on  Heidi again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say a thing against her?  God  forbid I should say anything against  that fat cunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.  Mom.  There are some things a  mother shouldn't say in front of her  son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she comes down here, so help me  I'm gonna mash her brains in.   Everything in your life was sunlight  and roses until you met her.  Since  then, forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't have anything to do with  it!  You understand that?  Mother?   This is me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you wouldn't need Leon if  Heidi was treating you right.  The  thing I don't understand is why you  come out and sleep with Heidi anyway?   You got two kids on welfare now.   What're you goin' to bed with her,  you don't have enough with one wife  and two kids on welfare, you want a  wife and three kids on welfare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this is old stuff) Not now, Mom, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll you do?  Come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patiently - I told  you a hundred times) I can't, Mom.  If I come out Sal  will kill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (she thinks for a  moment) Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell for?  Twenty-five years  in the pen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe!  Aw Christ, what dreams you  live on!  Maybe what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him.  He talks slowly and carefully to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a fuckup and an outcast.  There  isn't one single person in my life I  haven't hurt through my love.  You  understand that?  I'm the most  dangerous person in the world, because  if I love you, watch out, you're  gonna get fucked, fucked over and  fucked out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Pop come down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  This really pissed him off,  Sonny.  He says you're dead.  He  says he doesn't have a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.  You shoulda done what  he did.  Go home. (embraces her) Don't talk to the FBI anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away and moves toward the bank door.

dialogues.speaker: ON VI
dialogues.text: Her desperate smile, apologetic and false at the same tim glistens with a mother's tears.  After a long beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember how beautiful you were. As a baby you were so beautiful.  We  had such hopes.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: as Sonny enters and stops, controlling his emotions.  He  walks toward Mulvaney, who is putting visitor's chair bac into position, then waters his plant. Maria and Miriam are still dancing; Margaret is at her de Sal, Jenny and Deborah are in the Conference Room; Sylvia still behind Tellers' Cages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Mulvaney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I had some legal training, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to dictate my will.  I need a  notary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a notary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves Tellers' Cages area, crosses to Sonny, grabbin pen from Edna's desk on the way.  Sonny's urgent mood rea them.  Sylvia gets note pad from Mulvaney.  Takes the  dictation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being of sound mind and body, and  all that shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylvia nods: got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To my darling wife Leon whom I love  as no other man has loved another  man in all eternity, I leave $2,700  from my $10,000 life insurance policy,  to be used for your sex change  operation.  If there is money left  over it is to go to you on the first  anniversary of my death, at my grave.   I expect you to be a real woman then,  and your life full of happiness and  joy.  To my sweet wife, Heidi, five  thousand from the same policy.  You  are the only woman I have ever loved,  and I re-pledge my love to you in  this sad moment, and to little Kimmy  and Jimmy.  I hope you remember me,  Jimmy.  You are the little man of  the family now, and will have to  look after them for me.  To my mother  I ask forgiveness.  You don't  understand the things I did and said,  but I'm me, and I'm different.  I  leave you, the rest of the policy  and my stamp collection.  I want a  military funeral and am entitled to  one free of charge.  Life and love  are not easy and we have to bend a  lot.  I hope you find the places and  the people to make you all happy as  I could not.  God bless you and watch  over you, as I shall, until we are  joined in the hereafter, sweet Leon,  my Heidi, dearest Kimmy and Jimmy,  and my mother.  Sonny... here I'll  spell the last name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits and writes it for Sylvia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Type that up and I'll sign it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody says anything about this document.  What is there say?  Sylvia walks to her desk at the front of the bank,  near the window, and begins typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restless crowd STIRS, sensing something happening.   Turning to see something coming.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT FIRE ESCAPE
dialogues.text: The Cops gear up their weapons: radios CRACKLE.  Somethin a vehicle, is moving through the crowd, Cops shoving peop aside to let it through.  The Old Lady pays no attention. She is down to one of the very last pieces of the puzzle is searching for the spot for it.

dialogues.speaker: CLEAR PLACE IN FRONT OF BANK
dialogues.text: as the vehicle clears the crowd and slowly draws up in fr It is a long airport limousine of the type with many door It stops.  Everyone's attention is on it.  A black DRIVER gets out, a gay Afro knit on his head, coke dealer's shad for the cognoscenti, one very long little finger nail, a  nifty Van Dyke style beard and one gold front tooth.  He  looks around, holding a sheet of paper.  Sheldon, others, approach.  They are looking into the vehicles, opening do checking tires, etc.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR OF BANK
dialogues.text: Sonny appears.  He strides to the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Get away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment the Cops all move back.  Sonny opens the f door and begins to check it out.  The Driver starts to mo away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These seats come out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY AND DRIVER
dialogues.text: Together they remove the seat so Sonny can check for guns concealed below, etc.  Improvise to fit conditions of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dawning on him) Jesus, you're the man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, what's under this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pry up a seat and look under, etc., all through:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was lookin' at it.  I saw you,  man!  Jesus!  You oughta see yourself!   You wouldn't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it, Sheila isn't gonna  believe it.  They just call in and  say gas up a stretchout and get it  down to (address in Brooklyn) and I say, 'shit, another load of  Elks for the massage parlors.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finished) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stands up, getting a good look at Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, by God I'm gonna remember you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he turns and walks away. Driver stops, uncertainly.  Cops grab him to hustle him a Sheldon steps forward with a neat twenty-years-younger ca copy of himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your driver, this is agent  Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny and Murphy.  Sonny eyes Murphy,  thinks, then begins to frisk Murphy.   He finds nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up and eyes Murphy.  He just doesn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can he do, he's clean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme the black guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver is still close enough to hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping everybody) Come on, nobody's gonna get hurt. If they were gonna shoot, they'd  shoot now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't allow that, Sonny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't allow!  I'm running this  thing, what gives you the idea you  can say shit? (to Driver) Come on.  I'll pay you.  Whatta you  want?  Two hundred?  A thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver looks around desperately to the FBI, to get hi out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at him.  I'm running this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  Sheldon finally reluctantly nods.  Sonny motions him (the Driver) to step forward.  Before he can get in t car, Sonny stops him.  Signals to him to get ready.  Give him a thorough pat search.  Thighs, the whole bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is tense.  The Driver seems uptight.  Sonny finds noth until he touches a breast pocket.  The Driver is very upt Sonny reaches in, pulls out a -- tiny bottle, with a coke spoon chained to the lid.  Before Sheldon can see it, but the audience has, Sonny shoves it back, grins, slaps the  Driver on the buns.  The Driver laughs delightedly. He was afraid he'd get busted for the dope: the drive wil be a cakewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to FBI) You men shoot, aim for the white  meat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loves the joke!  They act as though they hadn't heard. Sonny slaps him playfully on the arm and smiling turns to Sheldon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at Murphy.  Sheldon stands there speechless. Driver stares at Sonny, his smile fading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delighted) What do you think you're dealing  with, an idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon nods to Driver and Murphy.  Murphy resumes role a driver of the limo.  Driver gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, copper.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY AND MURPHY
dialogues.text: as they position the stretchout in front of the bank.  It can be seen from inside.  The FBI men stand well back fro it.  Murphy stands by the door.  He also can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Sonny?  You follow my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy nods.  Sonny is satisfied and turns to the bank, t Murphy into vestibule, indicating for him to stay there. Sonny continues toward group at rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylvia is finishing her typing.  The girls and Mulvaney a slowly getting ready.  Deborah is getting her purse out o Margaret's desk drawer; Margaret gathering her own purse, books, etc.; Jenny is getting her purse from Edna's desk Edna gathers up her belongings; Mulvaney is seated at his desk; Miriam is at her desk, by the front door. Sal stands with his gun ready.  [As Sonny enters and take up his gun, Sal carefully and methodically begins to redr himself, comb his rumpled hair, knotting his tie carefull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he rebuilds his sartorial image before the various  reflecting surfaces of the bank, knotting his tie in a gl partition, checking his suit for wrinkles in a glass door etc.  Meanwhile we are seeing the following, which Sal  ignores:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, let's get ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets up, walks to  Sonny) Sonny - Here's your document.

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: looking at the will, taking up pen.

dialogues.speaker: ON SYLVIA, MULVANEY
dialogues.text: watching him with compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny signs fast and firmly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylvia's notary seal clamps and imprints the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, okay!  What a bunch of  cold fish.  It's an adventure! Everybody's gonna remember you the  rest of your lives, the day you got  held up and kidnapped... hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eye has struck some reminder.  They handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got Bank Americard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tired) What now, Sonny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gathers money from  near-by money bag) Listen, I owe a couple hundred  dollars!  I don't wanta leave owing  anybody anything!  A clean slate, a  new leaf...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plunks his card down before Sylvia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I paying off. (money from attached  case) Here.  Two hundred should do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start the action of filing the form and accepting th money... Sonny stops them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me a receipt.  Hey, Sal,  you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep in his hair or  tie or?) Okay, Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. (accepts receipt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your document, Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - it looks real official.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are ready.  A moment in the dark.  Sonny holds out t will to Mulvaney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulvaney takes it.  Sonny shakes his hand.  Suddenly,  emotionally, he embraces Sylvia.  Suddenly they are all s silent goodbyes.  Shaking hands all around, formally. Only Sal is left untouched, standing apart, watching them in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone waits in silence.  The lights.  The limo.  The D waiting in the driver's seat.  After a beat the door begi to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Cops' guns are brought to bear.  On the apartment fire escape the Old Lady is asleep, her puzzle complete.  The  snipers raise their rifles.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF BARBER SHOP
dialogues.text: Sheldon stands there.  The police radio network CRACKLES: "They're coming out.  Perpetrators and hostages together. Only authorized personnel may previously authorized, and  etc."  Sheldon's eyes go to:

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: A middle-aged Man who looks like an overweight accountant in flak vest and helmet that seems too small, aiming thro a telescopic sight at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (letting Murphy out  first; yells outside) Get away from the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something that looks like a multi-legged animal emerges. is Sonny and Sal in the center of a tight group of the gi and Mulvaney, so they are completely protected on all sid by hostages.  Over their heads is thrown some drapes from the bank that further prevent the police from drawing a c head on Sonny or Sal without hitting a girl.  In fact the can't be seen at all.  This weird apparition appears,  hesitates.  The crowd YELLS: "SHOOT!"  CHOREOGRAPH THE AC so the group hesitates, takes a step forward, then it's c Sonny can't see well enough to go direct to the car, and girls are uncertain which direction to go in, not having  been briefed.  So they stumble about, make false starts, finally arrive at the car, where one girl gets into the s row of seats behind the Driver.  Then Sonny slides across next to Driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police have no chance to shoot.  The group looks like bewildered centipede finding its way.  Mulvaney detaches  himself from the group and slips into the front seat, on  Sonny's right.

dialogues.speaker: ON EDNA
dialogues.text: standing alone, outside filled-up limo.  Sheldon walks ov to Mulvaney's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheldon) Okay - you got your one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Murphy) You follow my car. (he moves off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria gets in the rear-most row of seats.  Sal next to he in the middle and then another girl.
