One woman, Edna, a  plain middle-aged woman who has not said a word until now left over.  She stands by the side of the limo as the doo close and this phase of the operation ends, without misha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (elated) Fuck!  We did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Edna) Goodbye, honey.  Wish us luck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna pecks out dry little kisses to the nearest girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Edna pecks... goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be a son of a bitch -- we're  all okay!  Hey, man!  Honk the horn. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal has his gun pointed on back of Driver's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sal - do me a favor... point  that gun up, huh?  We hit a bump and  the fuckin' gun'll go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver honks the HORN: they're ready.  The crowd SCRE Cops keep jockeying for position, but there is no way to a shot in.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHELDON
dialogues.text: No emotion.  He steps into his car, a police car pulls up behind, and the procession starts to pull slowly toward t crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ON EDNA AND BANK
dialogues.text: As the limo pulls away, she is bewildered by the rush of  police, bank people, FBI men who stream past her, ignorin her, all pouring into the bank.  TV crews move by and fin one stops to interview her.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CARAVAN
dialogues.text: being rammed through the jam of Cops and screaming people trying to get a last look.  The hostages looking out, wan worried.  Sonny and Sal inside, alert, ready with guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal - please keep that gun pointed  up, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MOVING SHOTS
dialogues.text: from inside the limo.  The faces of the poor, the excited the vicious the curious, and in ONE SHOT some of the peop from the Gay Liberation Movement carrying hastily lettere signs: one protesting Sonny: YOU ARE AN INSULT TO YOUR KIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another: WE LOVE LOVE LOVE YOU SONNY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their scared and wan faces swim past in the mob.  Sonny's mother is briefly seen looking out of the barber shop win alone and forgotten.  The Cops stare heavily, sullen with anger. Now the limo is moving faster.  People are running alongs YELLING insults, trying to see in, asking for hand-outs, they are going faster.  Inside, they say nothing.  Up ahe Sheldon's car flashes a red light.  Behind, the police ca does the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the procession moves through Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter follows above them.

dialogues.speaker: VIEWS IN STREETS
dialogues.text: They move along, followed by a HONKING parade of kibitzin cars, like a Mexican wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn onto the thruway, trying to out-distance the ca tagging along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  Sonny and Sal hold their rifles ready between t knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they veer off the thruway, a barely seen Guard swings  open a gate and they ROAR through.  The Guard pushes the  gate to, and the following caravan of cars brakes, skids a pile-up of fender bender accidents begin, cars going in the fence and each other.

dialogues.speaker: THRUWAY
dialogues.text: Cars are strewn all around.  Doors open and Drivers leap ready to YELL and do battle.  The Cops guard the now clos gate.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY AIRPORT
dialogues.text: Distant lights, some moving.  Total darkness.  The FBI ca the limo, the following police car move across the darkne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit quiet, following the FBI car.  The FBI car stops They stop.  Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, can you see what they're  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still got some arrangements to  make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon is getting out of the car up ahead.  Sonny and Sa and all of them come alert.  As Sheldon and the other FBI men get out of their car, a pair of aircraft landing ligh become visible, taxiing towards the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is, Sal.  Sal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus!  Hey.  How about food? I forgot to ask to have food on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon has been walking down to the limo.  He stops besi Mulvaney and KNOCKS on the window.  Mulvaney rolls it dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the jet.  You give us one  more, now.  That's the deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Which one goes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is silence inside the limo.  Mulvaney turns to Sylv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylvia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a handkerchief, Sylvia draws a slip of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Maria.  Go on, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They open the door.  They urge her out, and Maria goes wi a show of reluctance.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARIA
dialogues.text: As she stands up outside she is revealed to have a rosary she's counting.  IMPROVISE goodbyes, tearful and fearful around.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pray for your safety... (meaning Sonny and  Sal) ...Sal?  Because I know it's your  first plane trip.  Don't be scared,  you know? (gives him her rosary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Maria walks away.  Now the plane has taxied into posi where it can be seen in floodlights.  It looks big and  impressive.  We know the FBI has snipers ringing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't eaten all day.  I just  realized it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have hamburgers on the plane. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Sal again) Sal, keep it up, huh?  The gun -  please...

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: looking at the plane, grasping his money and his gun.  Th rifle stands straight up between his legs.  Sheldon leans down, peering in at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Sal?  You ready  to go?

dialogues.speaker: SAL
dialogues.text: in front of Sonny, behind Mulvaney.  For the first time h smiles.  He realizes that escape is within their grasp. smile transforms him from a formidable Mafia imitation in an utterly sweet and defenseless youth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gun pointing high) Hey, Sonny - You did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move it, goddamn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Driver) You ready to get out first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver starts to turn in the driver's seat! Sheldon brings up his hands to reach through the open win to grab Sonny's rifle barrel, pushes it away, aiming out  windshield. Mulvaney sees them beginning their move and starts to duc Sal begins to see movement out of the corner of his eyes is barely beginning to react.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER TURNING HAS A GUN OVER THE BACK OF THE SEAT
dialogues.text: Sonny sees it, and Sheldon's hand grabbing the barrel of gun at the same moment. Sheldon drives hard into the side of the limo, reaching i Mulvaney grabs the girl next to him and pulls her by the  hair down toward the floor. Sal, open-mouthed with amazement, is a split-second late  bringing his gun up. Driver completes his turn and has his gun leveled at Sal  between Miriam and Margaret in middle row. Sheldon grabs his rifle barrel and pulls hard.  Sonny let it go. Sal stares at the gun barrel, trying to get his gun up... Driver FIRES. Mulvaney hits the floor. Sheldon holds Sonny's gun. Sonny, CLOSE, watches. Sal, hit, slams back into the seat; the gun flies upward. Another SHOT hits him, flinging his head back. Driver holds his third shot, turns to Sonny - holds gun t his temple. Sonny looks down so he can see fully as: Sal's head snaps back for a split second and stares direc into Sonny's eyes, upside down. He stares sadly, into Sonny's eyes.  As though he knew it all along -- betrayed. And dies. The SHOT is ECHOING.  Now SCREAMS, YELLS, SLAMMING doors, panic... Sonny's voice:  "Shoot me!  For God's sake, shoo me!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come pouring out of the limo, scrambling frantically away from it.  The limo -- the people fleeing it.  Agents pull people away from the car. Driver and Sheldon and Cops peer into the back.  Sal's bo lies slumped. Driver, Sheldon, other Cops stand about, recovering.  No makes the slightest sort of congratulatory move, it was j another job.  Driver clears his weapon, hands it to Sheld to be filed in case of investigation.

dialogues.speaker: ON SYLVIA, MULVANEY, HOSTAGES
dialogues.text: They hug, cry, laugh, jump up and down: they're alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mulvaney) I been dying to do this for years!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she kisses him hard in the mouth.  He laughs and kiss back...

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Tears are beginning to flood past his defenses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are under arrest.  You have the  right to remain silent.  You have  the right to counsel to be present,  during your interrogation. (etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice is dry, as though he were reciting from memory  something he learned in a language he doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: like a Warhol interview on TV.  Segue VOICE TRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't see how Sonny can  survive in prison, he was very loud,  very boisterous.  He was obnoxious.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD SHOT
dialogues.text: being manipulated like so much beef by impersonal FBI  agents...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was very hard to live with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made me laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remnants of the crowd of sightseers, being interviewed by men avid for more, more, more news... these are people am the group that held up the big banner earlier: now we see them up CLOSE.  They're folding up their banner.  A very  ordinary-looking YOUNG GUY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love him.  He put an end to all  that pansy limp wristed shit!

dialogues.speaker: FBI AND SONNY
dialogues.text: They're getting off his belt, his shoe laces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he always had a way of getting  out, always in the army he was AWOL...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SONNY
dialogues.text: manacled and helpless.  He is twisted into some yet more  uncomfortable position by the uncaring Agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help thinking how he might  ring the bell one of these days. That's why I'm nervous, because I'm  always thinking some day he's gonna  come along and ring the bell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE SHOT Sal's body is carried, Sonny, seeing it of the corner of his eye.  He tries to look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes front.

dialogues.speaker: PAULINE NATURILE
dialogues.text: A faded, rattled woman, perhaps a little drunk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know your son was  involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw Sal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a long time.  Because I kept  asking my husband where the heck  could Junior be?  He wasn't around  here.  I thought maybe he was in  prison or some place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know he was a homosexual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not until after they killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you always call him Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember anything else about  Sal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SONNY
dialogues.text: Sonny isn't even listening... he sees something o.s.:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hostages moving toward a car to take them home are pa nearby and turn to look at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye!  You were terrific!  Mouth! You're beautiful!  See you!

dialogues.speaker: THEIR REACTIONS
dialogues.text: They stare at him; they've already begun to forget him: t moment in the bank when they said their goodbyes is alrea receding from their consciousness.  Their smiles are forc and they don't really know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Sonny!  Good luck, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were terrific, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  It's raining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, as the first welcome drops of cooling rain fall, the begin to move fast...

dialogues.speaker: ON SONNY
dialogues.text: looking after them.  The rain hitting his face... the  adventure is over.  But the everlasting smile overtakes h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad.  Life is easier with him  in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be like always, the bell  would ring, we'd have a ball.

dialogues.speaker: AS LEON IS SEEN
dialogues.text: LEON IS NOW A WOMAN NAMED LANA.
